    • Method Detail

      • setCredentials

        void setCredentials(java.lang.String username,
                  java.lang.String password)
        Sets the username and password for the session. This must be set prior to calling "startSession()"
        Parameters:
        username - Your username
        password - Your password

      • startSession

        void startSession()
        Initializes the session relative to the appropriate login credentials and box.

      • uploadDocument

        org.apache.chemistry.opencmis.client.api.Document uploadDocument(java.lang.String folderId,
                                                               java.lang.String fileName,
                                                               java.lang.String filePath,
                                                               java.lang.String contentType,
                                                               java.lang.String version,
                                                               java.lang.String description)
                                                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Upload a local document to the repository
        Parameters:
        folderId - The objectID of the folder into which you wish to upload your document.
        fileName - The name that the uploaded document will assume on the server.
        filePath - The path to the file you wish to upload.
        contentType - The content type associated with the document, IE "cmis:document". If null, "cmis:document" is supplied as a default.
        version - The document version associated with the uploaded document.
        description - The description metadata you may wish to post attached to the document. null or "" are appropriate arguments, if that's what you want.
        Returns:
        Returns a Document object representing the file you just uploaded to the server.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • createFolder

        org.apache.chemistry.opencmis.client.api.Folder createFolder(java.lang.String path,
                                                           java.lang.String folderName)
        Creates an empty folder in the repository, given the path in the repo, and a name.
        Parameters:
        path - The String representation of the path in the repo, to where you wish to create your folder.
        folderName - The name you wish to give your new folder.
        Returns:
        Returns a Folder object representation of the folder you just created in the repo.

      • uploadFolder

        org.apache.chemistry.opencmis.client.api.Folder uploadFolder(java.lang.String folderId,
                                                           java.lang.String folderName,
                                                           java.lang.String folderPath)
                                                             throws java.io.IOException
        Upload a folder, including all containing files and sub-folders, to the repository.
        Parameters:
        folderId - The objectID of the Folder inside which you wish to upload the local folder and subdirectory.
        folderName - The name of the root folder as it will appear in the repository
        folderPath - The path to the local root folder of the directory you wish to upload to the server
        Returns:
        Returns a Folder object representation of the root folder you just uploaded.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        Retrieve a folder from the repository
        Parameters:
        objectId - The objectId of the folder you wish to retrieve
        Returns:
        Returns the Folder object representation of the folder in the repository, which you can update/delete/otherwise manipulate

        Returns:

      • getDocumentThumbnail

        org.apache.chemistry.opencmis.client.api.Rendition getDocumentThumbnail(org.apache.chemistry.opencmis.client.api.Document doc)
        Retrieves the thumbnail representation of the given Document.
        Parameters:
        doc - The Document object representation of the thumbnail you wish to retrieve.
        Returns:
        Returns a Rendition object, which is the class encapsulation of all alternate representations of a normal CMIS object. A thumbnail is one such alternate representation of a document.

      • getAlfrescoThumbnailUrl

        java.lang.String getAlfrescoThumbnailUrl(org.apache.chemistry.opencmis.client.api.Document doc)
        Forms a URL that retrieves the thumbnail of a document in the Alfresco data store, if available.
        Parameters:
        doc - The document who's Alfresco thumbnail URL you wish to retrieve.
        Returns:
        Returns the URL that accesses Alfresco's thumbnail retrieval webservice.

        Forms a URL that retrieves the full document from the Alfresco data store.
        Parameters:
        doc - The document whose URL you'd wish to retrieve.
        Returns:
        Returns a URL that accesses the file passed in as an argument.

      • updateDocumentMetadataByProperty

        IObjectID updateDocumentMetadataByProperty(org.apache.chemistry.opencmis.client.api.Document doc,
                                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> properties)
        Takes in a Map of Document properties you wish to change, and alters the the given Document to reflect those changes.
        Parameters:
        doc - The Document object who's metadata properties you wish to alter.
        properties - The Map of properties and values to which the given Document will update.
        Returns:
        Returns an IObjectID which contains the short and long ObjectID of the newly updated Document.

        Parameters:

        docToUpdate - The Document who's content you wish to change.
        Returns:
        Returns and IObjectID which contains the short and long ObjectID of the newly updated document.

        Parameters:
        folderId - The ObjectId of the Folder who's contents you wish to download locally.
        localDestination - The path to the Folder to where you wish download the contents of the given Folder.

      • createDocumentInputStream

        java.io.InputStream createDocumentInputStream(java.lang.String newName,
                                            java.lang.String filePath)
        Creates the InputStream of a new Document. InputStreams can be used to leverage the Apache Tika plugin to scrape additional metadata off the documents we wish to upload .
        Parameters:
        newName - The name of the new Document.
        filePath - The local path to the file content.
        Returns:
        Returns a ContentStream containing the new Document's name and content.

      • createDocumentContentStream

        org.apache.chemistry.opencmis.commons.data.ContentStream createDocumentContentStream(java.lang.String newName,
                                                                                   java.lang.String filePath)
        Creates the ContentStream of a new Document. ContentStreams can be used to upload content to a repository using the uploadDocument() method.
        Parameters:
        newName - The name of the new Document.
        filePath - The local path to the file content.
        Returns:
        Returns a ContentStream containing the new Document's name and content.

      • doesAlfrescoThumbnailExist

        java.lang.Boolean doesAlfrescoThumbnailExist(org.apache.chemistry.opencmis.client.api.Document doc)
        The method takes a CMIS Document as an argument and tells you whether or not Alfresco autogenerates thumbnail images for that particular document.
        Parameters:
        doc - The Document whose Alfresco thumbnail situation you want to know about.
        Returns:
        Returns True if Alfresco auto-generates a thumbnail for the Document's mimetype.
